snippet: A man with a two-pack-a-day habit is very sick, but it’s not lung cancer.
abstract: Lisa Sanders Diagnosis column describes the difficult diagnosis of man suffering from pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis, a tobacco-related lung illness. (M)
lead_paragraph: The 48-year-old man leaned forward to catch his breathas another paroxysm of coughing left him struggling for air. He could feel the sweat cooling on his face as the coughing died down. He stubbed out his cigarette angrily. If he was too sick to smoke, he must be pretty darn sick. 1. STRANGE HOLES
